definition: brazen/shameless/impudent/cheek/thick-skinned
thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress
face/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
leather/skin/fur/CL:張|张[zhang1]/pico- (one trillionth)/naughty
surname Pi

sentences.english: If you want to be a good salesman, you must be thick-skinned.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要成爲一個好的推銷員，你一定要厚臉皮。

sentences.english: This is shameless, I know, but that’s part of the job. (Laughter.)
sentences.chinese: 我知道這有點厚臉皮，但這是我工作的一部分。

sentences.english: He said incident reports were filed but ignored by brass.
sentences.chinese: 他說事件報告已經存檔了，但是被那些厚臉皮忽視了。

sentences.english: The foolhardy Zaarin even had the audacity to strike against the Emperor himself.
sentences.chinese: 有勇無謀的扎林甚至厚臉皮到了反擊帝國的地步。

sentences.english: He's really a thick - skinned gate-crasher.
sentences.chinese: 他真是個厚臉皮的不速之客。

sentences.english: Being thick-skinned is necessary for a successful salesperson.
sentences.chinese: 一位成功的推銷員所需要的就是厚臉皮。
他亦是一個厚臉皮的煽動家。

sentences.english: The brassy boys put their tongues out at us.
sentences.chinese: 那些厚臉皮的男孩兒朝着我們伸舌頭。

sentences.english: There is no better time to develop some thick skin than after a rejection.
sentences.chinese: 被拒絕後是練就厚臉皮的最佳時機。

sentences.english: Muzzle moderately pointed, avoiding any tendency toward snipiness or cheekiness .
sentences.chinese: 口吻略微有點尖，不能象被截斷的樣子或厚臉皮。

definition: brazen
to argue/to reason with sb/to talk sense/to be reasonable
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side/to have the courage of one's convictions/just and forceful
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
be smooth and slick (in establishing social relations)
direct and plainspoken (idiom); blunt/straightforward
to make a long story short (idiom)
to tell lies
to bear grudges
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
hopelessly muddled/impossible to unravel
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
